security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only instructional markdown. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, and no external commands. This is a knowledge-only skill that provides guidance for DEX liquidity analysis.

content.user_title: Analyze DEX liquidity depth and slippage
content.value_statement: MEV trading requires precise liquidity analysis to avoid excessive slippage and failed transactions. This skill provides systematic workflows and formulas for calculating price impact, estimating slippage, and validating trade profitability before execution.
actual_capabilities: Check liquidity depth against trade size with configurable multipliers
Calculate price impact in basis points (bps) for swap transactions
Estimate minimum output amount after slippage tolerance
Validate arbitrage profitability after accounting for slippage
Provide configurable thresholds for price impact and depth requirements
limitations: Does not connect to live DEX APIs or fetch real-time pool data
Does not execute trades or interact with blockchain networks
Does not provide historical liquidity analysis or charts
Formulas assume constant product AMM model (may not suit all DEXs)

use_cases.title: Validate trade execution
use_cases.description: Check if proposed trade size has sufficient liquidity before submitting on-chain transactions.

use_cases.title: Implement swap routing
use_cases.description: Integrate liquidity checks and slippage calculations into decentralized exchange applications.

use_cases.title: Model arbitrage opportunities
use_cases.description: Calculate whether arbitrage profits survive slippage and execution costs.

prompt_templates.title: Check Trade Feasibility
prompt_templates.prompt: Check liquidity depth for trading 10000 USDC to ETH on Uniswap V3. Pool fee tier is 0.3%. Available liquidity at current price is approximately $50000.

prompt_templates.title: Calculate Price Impact
prompt_templates.prompt: Calculate the expected price impact in basis points for a 500 ETH swap on a Uniswap V2 pool with 10000 ETH and 50000000 USDC in reserves.

prompt_templates.title: Validate Arbitrage
prompt_templates.prompt: An arbitrage opportunity shows 0.8% profit. With 0.5% max slippage configured, will this trade be profitable? Show calculations.

prompt_templates.title: Configure Risk Parameters
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure liquidity analysis with max_price_impact_bps of 75 and max_slippage_bps of 150. Check if a $100000 trade is viable on a pool with $800000 depth.

output_examples.input: Analyze if a 5000 USDC to ETH trade is viable on a pool with 45000 USDC and 15 ETH reserves.
output: Depth check: 45000 USDC liquidity is 9x the trade size (above 3x minimum)
Price impact: Approximately 0.49% or 49 bps (below 0.5% threshold)
Recommendation: Trade is viable with low slippage risk
Max slippage at 1%: Would reduce ETH received by approximately 50 USDC worth

best_practices: Always verify liquidity depth is at least 3x your trade size before execution
Set conservative slippage tolerance (0.5-1%) to protect against front-running
Re-check liquidity before submitting large trades as conditions change rapidly
anti_patterns: Executing trades without checking available liquidity first
Setting slippage too tight (risking transaction failure) or too loose (risking MEV extraction)
Ignoring price impact calculations for large positions relative to pool depth

faq.question: Which DEXs does this skill support?
faq.answer: The formulas work for constant product AMMs like Uniswap V2, SushiSwap, and similar DEXs using the x*y=k model.

faq.question: What are the default risk thresholds?
faq.answer: Default max price impact is 50 bps (0.5%), max slippage is 100 bps (1%), and minimum depth multiplier is 3x.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into my trading bot?
faq.answer: Yes, the TypeScript config example can be copied directly into your codebase for programmatic liquidity analysis.

faq.question: Is my trading data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This skill runs entirely in-context. No data is stored, transmitted, or accessed outside your conversation.

faq.question: Why did my trade fail despite passing the liquidity check?
faq.answer: Liquidity can change rapidly on-chain. For large trades, consider splitting across multiple pools or routes to minimize impact.

faq.question: How does this compare to DEX aggregators like 1inch?
faq.answer: This skill provides the underlying calculations for understanding trade impact. Aggregators optimize routing automatically but do not expose their internal logic.
